test-industry-keyword.title: Meta expands Reels trending ads to advertisers globally
test-industry-keyword.snippet: Meta is opening up Reels trending ads to all advertisers globally.  The format uses AI to place ads after top-trending, creator-generated Reels.  Meta is also rolling out new ad products for Threads, including carousel ads and an expanded image format, and plans to test Advantage+ catalog ads and app ad campaigns on Threads.

test-industry-keyword.title: New particle detector passes the “standard candle” test
test-industry-keyword.snippet: The sPHENIX detector at RHIC has successfully completed a precision test, measuring the number and energy of particles from gold ion collisions. This "standard candle" test demonstrates its ability to precisely measure properties of quark-gluon plasma.

test-industry-keyword.title: How Do You Make a Mobile Game?
test-industry-keyword.snippet: Keywords Studios discusses the process of mobile game development, touching upon various aspects such as design, testing, and player research.

expanded-industry-term.title: US Manufacturing Expands at Fastest Pace Since 2022 on Demand
expanded-industry-term.snippet: US manufacturing is expanding at the fastest rate in more than three years on stronger demand that's also fueling sustained inflationary pressures.  The S&P Global flash August factory purchasing managers index rose 3.5 points to 53.3, the highest since May 2022.

expanded-industry-term.title: New U.S. Manufacturing Operations Announced in August 2025
expanded-industry-term.snippet: In August 2025, America's manufacturing base continued to expand across a wide range of sectors. Biotech companies announced cutting-edge pharmaceutical and medical isotope plants, heavy industry invested in energy infrastructure and materials production, and consumer goods makers expanded footprints to meet demand.

expanded-industry-term.title: US considers expanding chip revenue model to other industries, Bessent Says
expanded-industry-term.snippet: The United States may expand a revenue-sharing agreement with China on advanced semiconductor sales to other industries, US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent said, dismissing concerns over national security risks.

test-company-keyword.title: Graphene Just Broke a Fundamental Law of Physics
test-company-keyword.snippet: For the first time, scientists have observed electrons in graphene behaving like a nearly perfect quantum fluid, challenging a long-standing puzzle in physics.

test-company-keyword.title: Scientists Just Built a Detector That Could Finally Catch Dark Matter
test-company-keyword.snippet: Physicists have unveiled a new superconducting detector sensitive enough to hunt dark matter particles smaller than electrons.

test-company-keyword.title: The Invisible Plastic Threat You Can Finally See
test-company-keyword.snippet: Researchers in Germany and Australia have created a simple but powerful tool to detect nanoplastics—tiny, invisible particles that can slip through skin and even the blood-brain barrier.

expanded-company-term.title: Salesforce inks major New York office expansion to mirror growth across AI business
expanded-company-term.snippet: Salesforce is expanding its footprint at its namesake New York tower, adding more than 71,000 square feet as it grows to meet surging demand from the artificial intelligence boom.

expanded-company-term.title: Quantum Base wins PS250,000 contract expansion for Q-ID tech
expanded-company-term.snippet: Quantum Base Holdings PLC secured a £250,000 expansion to an existing contract with its largest customer, an international security printer, with revenue due in the current financial year ending April 30, 2026.

expanded-company-term.title: Curtiss-Wright Announces New $200 Million Expansion of 2025 Share Repurchase Program
expanded-company-term.snippet: Curtiss-Wright Corporation announced a $200 million expansion of its 2025 share repurchase program, which is now expected to result in record annual share repurchases in excess of $450 million in 2025.

test-regulatory-keyword.title: FDA Faces Blowback Over Stricter Regulation of Lab-Developed Tests
test-regulatory-keyword.snippet: The US Food and Drug Administration (FDA) is facing pushback over its plans to more strictly regulate lab-developed tests, which are designed, manufactured, and used in a single laboratory.  The new rule will treat these facilities as manufacturers and the tests as medical devices, requiring FDA review before sale and imposing new quality standards.

test-regulatory-keyword.title: Cruz introduces 'sandbox' bill and new AI framework
test-regulatory-keyword.snippet: Sen. Ted Cruz introduced a bill to create a federal regulatory "sandbox" for AI, allowing developers to apply for waivers or modifications of federal rules.  This is part of a wider Republican effort to advance President Trump's AI Action Plan.

test-regulatory-keyword.title: Updated Standards For Motorcycle Helmets
test-regulatory-keyword.snippet: Singapore's Traffic Police updated motorcycle helmet standards to align with international norms, including the UNECE R22.06 and Singapore Standard SS9:2024.  This aims to improve safety and lower helmet costs.

expanded-regulatory-term.title: Council to vote on stricter licensing, platform rules for short-term rentals
expanded-regulatory-term.snippet: The proposed ordinance would impose new licensing and eligibility standards, add enforcement mechanisms and expand regulatory obligations for platforms like Airbnb and VRBO.

expanded-regulatory-term.title: FDA issues guidance to expand non-opioid treatments for chronic pain
expanded-regulatory-term.snippet: The Food and Drug Administration released draft guidance on non-opioid treatments for treating chronic pain and reducing prescription opioid misuse.

expanded-regulatory-term.title: STRATEGIC PERSPECTIVES—Securities Regulation Daily's top 10 developments for August 2025
expanded-regulatory-term.snippet: August saw a continued push toward an expanded focus on digital assets and currency, from all sides of the industry. SEC Chair Paul Atkins launched the “Project Crypto” initiative, aiming at bringing digital assets fully within the regulatory sphere.
